intro: Keayodendron bridelioides, commonly known as the Bridelioides keayodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
